sub_title: PhD, Executive Director at Turquoise Coast Environment Fund - Turkey
summary:
I am currently working as an executive director of the Turquoise Coast Environment Fund part of the Conservation Collective. Previously, I worked as an international consultant for nature and environment, sustainable resource management and coastal zones, nature based solutions. My PhD focused on collaborative coastal zone management looking into sector issues: water, tourism, fishery. I have more than 20 years of experience working in the field of urban and rural environment, nature and landscape ecology and planning, coastal zones, stakeholder participation, including international experiences with diverse institutions: government; university; NGO; and businesses. I worked 10 years as Head of Capacity Building and Programme Manager for Nature and Society at ECNC- European Centre for Nature Conservation, in the Netherlands. I have established a large project in South Eastern Europe, which biodiversity and its benefits provided to local and regional communities through the development of ‘Local Biodiversity Action Plans’. My expertise lies in the linking with policy, practice and science in partnership projects at EU and global level. I have been involved in various training workshops as chair, facilitator, and moderator and worked closely with the EU-funded projects, UN FAO and civil society on the topic of green infrastructure, nature-based solutions and ecosystem-based adaptation to climate change, and stakeholder engagement in natural resource management. 

Specialties: Multidisciplinary project and programme management; Nature and Biodiversity; Urban Environmental Management; ICZM; collaborative coastal management; Marine Protected Areas; Sustainable Tourism; Facilitation, communication and dialogue; Biodiversity Action Planning; international and multi-cultural perspective; sustainable land and resource management; Agriculture; Landscape planning, Coastal Governance, Green Infrastructure and Nature-based Solutions in cities.
